001package imagingbook.calibration.zhang;
002
003import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
004
005import imagingbook.calibration.zhang.util.MathUtil;
006import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
007import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntDouble;
008import imagingbook.common.geometry.mappings.Mapping2D;
009
010
011/** 
012 * This class represents the 2D geometric transformation for an image taken 
013 * with some camera A to an image taken with another camera B.
014 * 
015 * @author W. Burger
016 * @version 2016-06-01
017 */
018public class InterCameraMapping implements Mapping2D {
019        
020        private final Camera camA, camB;
021        private final RealMatrix Abi;   // inverse of the intrinsic camera b matrix (2 x 3)
022
023        public InterCameraMapping (Camera camA, Camera camB) {
024//              this.isInverseFlag = true;      // maps target -> source
025                this.camA = camA;               // camera A (used to produce the source image)
026                this.camB = camB;               // camera B (determines the geometry the target image)
027                this.Abi = camB.getInverseA();
028        }
029        
030        @Override
031        public Pnt2d applyTo(Pnt2d uv) {
032                // (u,v) is an observed sensor point
033                // apply the inverse camera mapping to get the distorted (x,y) point:
034                double[] xy = Abi.operate(MathUtil.toHomogeneous(uv.toDoubleArray()));
035                
036                // remove the lens distortion of camera b:
037                double[] xyu = camB.unwarp(xy);
038                
039                // apply the lens distortion of camera a:
040                double[] xyd = camA.warp(xyu);
041                
042                // apply the (forward) camera mapping to get the undistorted sensor point (u',v'):
043                return PntDouble.from(camA.mapToSensorPlane(xyd));
044        }
045
046//      @Override
047//      public double[] applyTo(double x, double y) {
048//              return this.applyTo(new double[] {x, y});
049//      }
050
051}
